enWisdom: Contentment enriches
Contentment is the cornerstone of prosperity
A rich person is he who becomes rich through contentment
A [truly] rich person is one who prefers contentment
The brother of affluence is one who covers himself with contentment
Contentment and obedience bring about prosperity and honour
The contented one is rich, even if he is hungry and unclothed
Contentment is the better of the two riches
The richest of you are the most contented among you
The wealthiest of all people is the contented one

Wisdom: أَغْنَى الْغِنَى الْقَنَاعَةُ وَالتَّحَمُّلُ فِي الْفَاقَةِ
enWisdom: The greatest of riches is contentment and toleration of poverty
Verily in contentment there is prosperity

Wisdom: إِنَّ أَكْرَمَ [أَكْيَسَ‏] النَّاسِ مَنِ اقْتَنَى الْيَأْسَ وَلَزِمَ الْقُنُوعَ وَالْوَرَعَ وَبَرِئَ مِنَ الْحِرْصِ وَالطَّمَعِ فَإِنَّ الطَّمَعَ وَالْحِرْصَ الْفَقْرُ الْحَاضِرُ وَإِنَّ الْيَأْسَ وَالْقَنَاعَةَ الْغِنَى الظَّاهِرُ
enWisdom: Verily the most honourable of all people is one who loses hope [in others], espouses contentment and piety and is devoid of greed and covetousness, for indeed covetousness and greed are a ready indigence and verily loss of hope [in others] and contentment are a manifest affluence

Wisdom: إِنَّكُمْ إِنْ قَنِعْتُمْ حُزْتُمُ الْغَنَاءَ وَخَفَّتْ عَلَيْكُمْ مُؤَنُ الدُّنْيَا
enWisdom: Verily if you become contented you will gain independence [and affluence] and the burden of worldly provisions will become lighter for you
When you seek wealth, then seek it through contentment
The fruit of contentment is prosperity

Wisdom: حَسْبُكَ مِنَ الْقَنَاعَةِ غِنَاكَ بِمَا قَسَمَ لَكَ [من‏] اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ
enWisdom: It is sufficient for your trust [in Allah] that you consider no one else as a channel for acquiring your sustenance other than Allah, the Glorified

Wisdom: عَلَيْكَ بِالْقُنُوعِ فَلَا شَيْ‏ءَ أَدْفَعُ لِلْفَاقَةِ مِنْهُ
enWisdom: You must have contentment, for indeed there is nothing that wards off poverty more than it

Wisdom: طُوبَى لِمَنْ ذَلَّ فِي نَفْسِهِ وَعَزَّ بِطَاعَتِهِ وَغَنِيَ بِقَنَاعَتِهِ
enWisdom: Blessed is he who considers himself as low, gains honour through his obedience [to Allah] and becomes free from want through his contentment
In contentment there is prosperity
Contentment has been paired with prosperity
Every contented one is rich
The whole of affluence is in contentment and satisfaction
Be contented and you will become rich
One who is content becomes rich [and independent]
One who is content gets satiated
One who is contented with the allotment of Allah becomes needless
One who is pleased with what has been decreed becomes content with little

Wisdom: مَنْ قَنِعَ بِرِزْقِ اللَّهِ اسْتَغْنَى عَنِ الْخَلْقِ
enWisdom: One who is content with the sustenance of Allah has no need for the creation
Whoever clings to contentment, his poverty disappears

Wisdom: مَنْ قَنِعَ بِقَسْمِ اللَّهِ اسْتَغْنَى عَنِ الْخَلْقِ
enWisdom: One who is contented with the allotment of Allah becomes needless of the people

Wisdom: مَنِ اكْتَفَى بِالْيَسِيرِ اسْتَغْنَى عَنِ الْكَثِيرِ
enWisdom: One who suffices with little becomes needless of plenty

Wisdom: نَالَ الْغِنَى مَنْ رُزِقَ الْيَأْسَ عَمَّا فِي أَيْدِي النَّاسِ وَالْقَنَاعَةَ بِمَا أُوتِيَ وَالرِّضَا بِالْقَضَاءِ
enWisdom: He who has been granted hopelessness in [obtaining] what people possess, contentment with what he is given and satisfaction with the divine decree has acquired affluence
There is no wealth like contentment
There is no affluence except through contentment
